words.source: Wayyiqtol (vav-consecutive imperfect); root יצא (yṣʾ); KJV 'brought them out', NASB 'took them out', NIV 'removed them'
Proper noun, subject of the verb; all translations agree
Direct object marker (את) + 3ms suffix; refers to Ephraim and Manasseh
Preposition מן (min) + preposition עם (ʿim); KJV 'from beside', NASB 'from his knees', NIV 'from Israel's knees'
Noun בִּרְכַּיִם (birkaim, dual) + 3ms possessive suffix; refers to Jacob's knees where the boys had been positioned
Wayyiqtol (vav-consecutive imperfect); root שׁחה (šḥh); KJV 'bowed himself', NASB 'bowed', NIV 'bowed down'
Preposition ל (le) + noun אַף (ʾaf, face) + 3ms suffix; idiom for prostration; KJV 'to his face', NASB 'with his face', NIV 'with his face'
Noun אֶרֶץ (ʾereṣ, earth/ground) + directional ה; all translations render as 'ground' or 'earth'
